TextSection.Contents: A rare disorder of the anterior segment of the eye characterized by chronic recurrent epithelial keratitis manifesting with groupings of small slightly elevated ovoid grayish-white intraepithelial opacities usually located in the central cornea. Patients present with photophobia tearing foreign body sensation and blurred vision. The condition is typically bilateral takes a relapsing-remitting course and is mostly self-limiting after a few years.
